intro: Dienia benguetensis, commonly known as the Benguet dienia, is a flowering plant native to the Philippines. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive leaves and small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in lowland and montane forests. It has a woody stem and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
